intro: Australina lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomatia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom in spring. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
